itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday July 22, 2014
teaser: Detroit’s bankruptcy created some anxiety about the ability of other U.S. cities to borrow money. We look at whether it’s gotten harder for cities to take out loans in the year since Detroit’s filing. Plus, schools in parts of Texas are trying a new approach to school lunches by offering free meals to all students. How big is the trend, and who will foot the bill? We report.
description: Detroit’s bankruptcy created some anxiety about the ability of other U.S. cities to borrow money. We look at whether it’s gotten harder for cities to take out loans in the year since Detroit’s filing. Plus, schools in parts of Texas are trying a new approach to school lunches by offering free meals to all students. How big is the trend, and who will foot the bill? We report.
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday July 22, 2014
byline: Nancy Marshall-Genzer, Noel King, Annie Baxter, David Brancaccio and Tracey Samuelson
